title: Scaffolding-Based Strategy Development for Advanced Foreign Language (English) Instructional Design Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level English Communication Skills and Foundational Experience in Educational Planning
context.additional_context: A Practice-Centered Course for Managers/Leaders to Strengthen Advanced Language Instruction Design Competencies. Conducted in a BYOD Environment with Integrated Online-Offline Activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply core principles of learning theories (e.g., constructivism, social learning) to English instructional design.
Learners can design at least three customized scaffolding strategies by analyzing learner characteristics (cultural background, job level).
Learners can develop English learning activities (e.g., case studies, role-playing) that promote critical thinking and cross-cultural communication.
Learners can design and operate performance-based assessment tools (e.g., portfolios, project presentations) applicable to real-life contexts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
